snippet: The international police organization issued a call Tuesday for help in arresting Tariq al-Hashimi, an Iraqi vice president, on terrorism charges, stepping into a bitter fight.
abstract: Interpol accepts Iraqi request for aid in arresting Tariq al-Hashimi, fugitive Sunni vice president who is being sought on terrorism charges; move is likely to add to tensions between Iraq's Shiite leadership and leaders in Turkey, where Hashimi has been staying under apparent government protection. Photo (M)

byline.original: By JACK HEALY; Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul

lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD -- The international police organization Interpol stepped squarely into a bitter political and sectarian fight on Tuesday when it responded to a request for help from Iraq to arrest the country's fugitive Sunni vice president on charges that he ran death squads inside Iraq. The move is likely to add tensions to relations between Iraq's Shiite leadership and leaders in Turkey, where the vice president, Tariq al-Hashimi, has been staying apparently with the blessing of the Turkish government since he fled his refuge in northern Iraq last month.

headline.main: Interpol Joins Effort To Find Iraq Official
